question: Lynching is:
exp: Lynching: Form of homicidal hanging. A suspect, an accused or an enemy is overpowered by several persons, acting jointly and illegally, and hung him by means of a rope from a tree or some similar object. It was prevalent in Noh America, where it was practiced by whites on blacks.

question: 'Le facies sympathique' is a condition seen in cases of:
exp: Le facies Sympathique is Seen in hangingQ***. One of the surest sign of ante moem hangingQ. Compression of sympathetic chain by the knot of rope. Results in ipsilateral dilatation of the pupil and paial opening of the eyelids.

question: Which of the following is not a type of suffocation-
exp: Throttling is a form of manual strangulation, not a form of suffocation. Suffocation deaths: SmotheringQ Occlusion ofexternal air passages. Qby hand, pillow, plastic bag etc ChokingQ Occlusion ofinternal air passages. Qby foreign body, food paicles etc Overlaying Compression of chestQ, when mother shares bed with baby GaggingQ Occlusion of internal air passages at pharyngeal level by a gagQ BurkingQ Smothering and traumatic asphyxia

question: Burking includes:
exp: Suffocation deaths: SmotheringQ Occlusion ofexternal air passages. Qby hand, pillow, plastic bag etc ChokingQ Occlusion ofinternal air passages. Qby foreign body, food paicles etc Overlaying Compression of chestQ, when mother shares bed with baby GaggingQ Occlusion ofinternal air passages at pharyngeal level by a gagQ BurkingQ Smothering and traumatic asphyxia Burking:

question: Which of this mechanism in Hanging is more associated with Amussat sign?
exp: Amussat's sign: Transverse carotid intimal tears may be seen in obese victims, long drops and posteriorly placed knots usually associated with Judicial hanging

question: A 50-year old chronic alcoholic while having dinner suddenly becomes aphonic and is brought to the casualty with the complaint of respiratory distress. Immediate management should be:
exp: The victim may be noticed collapsing over the dining table suddenly after having meals, without any signs of respiratory distress. The name, 'cafe coronary' is a misnomer. The intoxication causes suppression of gag-reflex which makes the individual susceptible to Cafe Coronary. Autopsy reveals a bolus of food in the pharynx or larynx. Cause of death is Asphyxia, followed by reflex cardiac arrest. Heimlich Manoeuvre can prevent choking & Cafe Coronary.

question: Dribbling of saliva is feature of:
exp: Signs of antemoem hanging: Salivary dribbling is seen on the opposite side of the knot. Le facie sympathique: is ipsilateral dilatation of the pupil and paial opening of the eyelids.

question: A person was brought to the emergency with a history of something stuck in his throat during his dinner which progressed to dyspnea, the probable diagnosis is:
exp: Suffocation deaths: SmotheringQ Occlusion of external air passages. Qby hand, pillow, plastic bag etc ChokingQ Occlusion of internal air passages. Qby foreign body, food paicles etc

question: On postmoem examination, contusion of neck muscles is seen along with fracture of hyoid bone. The most probable cause of death is:
exp: Frequency of hyoid bone fracture: Throttling (maximum)Q***> Hanging (more than 40 years of age) > ligature strangulation Characteristic features of throttling: Fracture of hyoid bone (greater cornu)Q Crescentic finger nail marksQ Fingeip bruises(six penny bruise)Q

question: Hyoid bone fracture does not occur in:
exp: Choking is a form of suffocation Hyoid bone fracture does not occur as there is no external compression over neck.

question: In case of Postmoem hanging, a ligature applied to the neck within how much time will produce a ligature mark
exp: A ligature applied to the neck within 2 hours will produce a ligature mark. Features of Postmoem hanging: A person may be murdered, and the dead body suspended to simulate suicide. Findings suggestive of postmoem hanging: A ligature applied to the neck within two hours of death will produce a ligature mark. Signs of dragging to the place of suspension. When a dead body is suspended, the rope is usually tied first around the neck, and then around the beam, branch of a tree, etc. The beam shows evidence of the rope having moved from below upwards as the body has been pulled up. In true suicidal hanging, the rope moves from above downwards. Fibres from the rope may be found on the hands of the victim in suicidal hanging, but not in case of postmoem hanging.

question: Isbella Ducan syndrome is:-
exp: Long scarf syndrome or long scarf syndrome:(Isbella Ducan syndrome) Accidental ligature strangulation may occur in the 'long-scarf syndrome' in which a clothing around the victim's neck (scarf or 'chunni/dupatta') becomes entangled, usually in a stationary or moving mechanical device (e. g. rickshaw or scooter wheel). The clothing becomes increasingly constricted owing to the continued action of the machine.

question: Masque Ecchymotique is seen in:-
exp: Traumatic asphyxia: Characteristic features seen are: Masque ecchymotique refers to the classical appearance of: Florid red or blue congestion of face and neck with variable involvement of the upper thorax, back and arms. Deep cyanosis of face. Numerous petechial hemorrhages or ecchymoses. Demarcation line: Level of compression is indicated by a well-defined demarcating line between the discolored upper poion of body and the lower normal pa.

question: The aefact seen in a case of suicidal complete hanging is
exp: Banding of the oesophagus is an aefact & non specific. These bands are pale areas in the mucosa caused by postmoem hypostasis being prevented from settling by the external pressure of larynx & trachea.

question: Spanish windlass is practiced in which form of strangulation:
exp: Garroting is a form of strangulation. In lonely places, robbers use this method to kill travelers & rob them. SPANISH METHODQ*** It is a method of judicial execution Qin Spain. Spanish windlass Q- is a type of Garroting It consists of iron collar placed around the neck & tightened by screw for strangulation.

question: The most common structure fractured in ligature strangulation is
exp: Ligature strangulation: Fracture of the thyroid cailage is more common, especially of one or both superior horns. Fracture of thyroid laminae and cricoid cailage is less common and occurs only when considerable force is used, or if some solid object is included in the ligature and applied over the front of the neck. Injury to the hyoid bone is not common, because the level of constriction is usually below the bone. Hyoid bone may be fractured in older persons in 10 to 15% of cases. Trachea is rarely broken.

question: The following is a type of:
exp: MUGGING: It is a type of strangulation caused by holding the neck of the victim in the bend of the elbow. Pressure is exeed either on front of the larynx, or at one or both sides of the neck by the forearm and upper arm.

question: Outward displacement of fractured hyoid bone is seen in:
exp: Hyoid Bone Fracture Anteroposterior compression fracture- Fractured segment displace outwards Known as abduction fracture Seen in hanging. Inward compression Fracture- Segment displace inwards. Known as adduction Seen in throttling Side to side compression fracture- seen in hanging.

question: Hanging in which body is fully suspended and feet are not touching the ground?
exp: HANGING ON THE BASIS OF SUSPENSION Hanging in which body is fully suspended and feet are not touching the ground is called complete hanging. Hanging in which feet or pa of body touches the ground and the body is not fully suspended is called paial hanging.

question: Most suggestive of anti moem hanging?
exp: Most suggestive of antemoem hanging is Salivary dribbling. There is no specific gold standard to distinguish between antemoem and postmoem hanging. However presence of: Veical salivary dribble mark from the dependant angle of mouth. The phenomenon of Le Facies sympathique. Hyperemia and echymosis of margins of ligature mark Horizontal tear of the intima of carotid aery at level of ligature with infiltration around. are considered as ante moem features of hanging. But obvious salivary dribble mark could be detected only in 56% of cases
